phonegame
Class GameItem

java.lang.Object
  phonegame.GameItem
Direct Known Subclasses:
MoveableGameItem
public abstract class GameItem
extends java.lang.Object

class GameItem represents an actor in the game that is not moving. GameItem is an abstract class. You have to make concrete classes yourself, by extending the GameItem class.

Version:
2.0, October 11, 2005, 2.1, April 24, 2006, 3.0, November 17, 2006
Author:
Tim Prijn, Richard Kettelerij & Paul Bergervoet

Field Detail

ACTIVE

public static final int ACTIVE
The state for active items, items that are not DELETED.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DELETED

public static final int DELETED
The state of deleted items. Items with this state will be automatically removed at the end of the cycle.

See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

GameItem

public GameItem()
Method Detail

animate

protected void animate()
Display a standard animation by looping through the frames. This method is called in every cycle of the game loop and just selects the next frame to be displayed. By default it calls nextFrame() to do an animation, looping through the frames.

Override this method to create your own custom animation. If you do not want any animation, override this method with an empty body { }.

getFrame

public int getFrame()
Gets the current index in the frame sequence.

Returns:
the index of of the current frame

getFrameCount

public int getFrameCount()
Gets the number of frames in the image.

Returns:
an integer containing the number of frames or 0 if no image is provided

getFrameHeight

public int getFrameHeight()
The height of one frame of the item's image. This equals the height of the complete image because frame strips are horizontal.

Returns:
an integer containing the height

getFrameWidth

public int getFrameWidth()
The width of one frame in case of an animating image or the width of the complete image in case of a static image.

Returns:
an integer containing the width

getGiState

public final int getGiState()
Get the state of the GameItem.

Returns:
state, ACTIVE or DELETED

getImage

public javax.microedition.lcdui.Image getImage()
Returns the image of this item.

Returns:
a image object or null if there isn't one

getX

public int getX()
Gets the horizontal position of this item (calculated from the upper-left corner).

Returns:
the horizontal position

getY

public int getY()
Gets the vertical position of this item (calculated from the upper-left corner).

Returns:
the vertical position

isActive

public final boolean isActive()
Check if item is active, that is: not deleted.

Returns:
boolean, true if item is active.

isVisible

public boolean isVisible()
Gets the visibility of this item.

Returns:
true if the item is visible, false if it is invisible.

nextFrame

public void nextFrame()
Selects the next frame in the frame sequence for drawing. The frame list is considered to be circular, i.e. if nextFrame() is called at the end of the list, this method will advance to the first frame in the list.

prevFrame

public void prevFrame()
Selects the previous frame in the frame sequence. The frame list is considered to be circular, i.e. if prevFrame() is called at the start of the list, this method will advance to the last frame in the list.

setFrame

public void setFrame(int index)
Selects the frame with the given index in the frame list. The GameItem will be painted with this frame.

Parameters:
index - the index of of the desired entry in the frame sequence

setImage

public void setImage(java.lang.String path)
              throws GameException
Define a fixed image that can be used to display this item. The image has just one frame.

Parameters:
path - relative location to the image file
Throws:
GameException - if the specified image is not found at the given path

setImage

public void setImage(java.lang.String path,
                     int frameWidth,
                     int frameHeight)
              throws GameException
Define a animating image that can be used to display this item.

Please note that this method can only handle horizontal filmstrips. This means that the frames in the image are to be placed horizontally next to each other, and not stacked like in a vertical filmstrip.

By default the frames will be played as an animation when displaying the item. Override the method animate() to do something else.

Parameters:
path - relative location to the image file
frameWidth - the width a single frame in the animation/filmstrip
frameHeight - the height a single frame in the animation/filmstrip
Throws:
GameException - if the specified image is not found at the given path

setPosition

public void setPosition(int x,
                        int y)
Sets the position of the item inside the game. There will be no collision detection.

Parameters:
x - the horizontal position
y - the vertical position

setVisible

public void setVisible(boolean visible)
Sets the visibility of this item.

Parameters:
visible - true to make the item visible, false to make it invisible
